definition: enough (sufficient)/enough (too much)/(coll.) (before adj.) really/(coll.) to reach by stretching out
to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb

sentences.english: The couple had a heck of an argument and kept us awake all night.
sentences.chinese: 爭得夠嗆，弄得咱們一晚上沒眨眼皮。

sentences.english: It is not the engagement, but the severe cold with which I perceive you are afflicted .
sentences.chinese: 原因倒不在於你有沒有約會，而是我看你正冷得夠嗆。

sentences.english: I'm so hungry I could eat a horse.
sentences.chinese: 我實在餓得夠嗆，一匹馬都喫的下。

sentences.english: Here too snow lay on the trees all around and it was bitterly cold, but they were at least protected from the wind.
sentences.chinese: 這兒冷得夠嗆，樹林也是銀裝素裹，但至少能擋風。

sentences.english: The coach jolted its passengers terribly over the miserable road.
sentences.chinese: 長途汽車在很糟糕的公路上行駛，把乘客們顛得夠嗆。

sentences.english: His hands are quite full enough without having me around.
sentences.chinese: 沒有我在身邊，他忙得夠嗆。

sentences.english: We've been really hard hit for money these years.
sentences.chinese: 這些年我們爲了錢，被折騰得夠嗆。
關節炎把她折騰得夠嗆。

sentences.english: The ghost story frightened the pants off me。
sentences.chinese: 這個鬼故事把我嚇得夠嗆。
